item.title: Psy returns with two new music videos- ‘New Face’ and ‘I Luv it’
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: Psy is back with his latest album ‘4×2=8‘. As with most of Psy’s music videos, the dancing and choreography does not
item.content:encoded:
Psy is back with his latest album ‘4×2=8‘. As with most of Psy’s music videos, the dancing and choreography does not disappoint.

He’s also accompanied by an army of beautiful white ladies in one of the scenes of ‘New Face’. It seems that he filmed in Las Vegas.

Check them out here:

item.title: 44 year old Korean singer Shim Mina shows off her impressive pole dancing abilities
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: Shim Mina is a South Korean singer and dancer who rose to fame in 2002 and became a Kpop singer.
item.content:encoded:
Shim Mina is a South Korean singer and dancer who rose to fame in 2002 and became a Kpop singer.

Recently, she was featured on the South Korean TV show ‘Taxi’ where she gave a tour of her house. One of the hosts of the show noticed that Mina had a pole dancing certificate, and she explained that she was a certified pole dancer and even had a pole in one of her rooms.

Mina agreed to give a demonstration of her abilities, and in doing so showed off her amazingly fit body. She is also currently dating a man 17 years younger than her, Kpop idol Ryu Philip.

Check out the video below and also Shim Mina’s Instagram.

item.title: Actor Henry Golding will play the Asian male lead for ‘Crazy Rich Asians’
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: Actor Henry Golding will be playing Nick Young in the movie ‘Crazy Rich Asians’, according to Hollywood Reporter: The story
item.content:encoded:
Actor Henry Golding will be playing Nick Young in the movie ‘Crazy Rich Asians’, according to Hollywood Reporter:

The story follows Rachel Chu (Wu), an American-born Chinese economics professor, who travels to her boyfriend Nick’s (Golding) hometown of Singapore for his best friend’s wedding. Before long, his secret is out: Nick is from a family that is impossibly wealthy, he’s perhaps the most eligible bachelor in Asia, and every single woman in his ultra-rarefied social class is incredibly jealous of Rachel and wants to bring her down.

Michelle Yeoh is attached to play Nick’s controlling mother who disapproves of Rachel.

So who is Henry Golding? The article states that he is half white on his father’s side, and his mother is Malaysian:

Golding, whose father is from England and his mother from the Iban tribe in Sarawak, Malaysia, is a true discovery. He is currently based in Singapore after growing up in London, and has never been featured in a film, but has experience hosting for TV travel shows. He is represented by management company FLY Entertainment in Singapore.

You can check out Henry Golding’s Instagram here.

item.title: Kpop boy band BTS interviews with Fox 4 News about their sold out concerts in America
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: BTS is a Kpop boy band from South Korea that has found recent success in America with sold out concerts.
item.content:encoded:
BTS is a Kpop boy band from South Korea that has found recent success in America with sold out concerts.

They joined Stephanie Summers, host of ‘The Morning Blend‘ on Fox 4 News for an interview.

“BTS is causing an unstoppable wave of interest in the U.S. by entering the music charts with high impact, competing against artists such as Lana Del Rey and Ed Sheeran, and more. International Kpop sensation BTS, they’re ready to make their mark as they prepare to hit the U.S. in just over two weeks,” said Summers.

Check out the video of the interview below:

item.title: The largest Tech company in South Korea has a female CEO
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: Naver, the biggest tech company in South Korea, has brought on Han Seong-sook as its first female CEO, according to
item.content:encoded:
Naver, the biggest tech company in South Korea, has brought on Han Seong-sook as its first female CEO, according to Forbes.

Han, who led search quality and general management at  Naver, is also the first non-engineer to lead the tech company. Seen as rational and passionate, the 50-year-old is said to know all 2,400 employees by name. Her alertness to the evolving demands of the tech industry apparently helped the tech giant find growth and global momentum.

She stresses the importance of Naver forming a sense of responsibility and mission to become a technology leader. She is leading efforts to step up support for creators and small businesses, vowing to provide user-friendly services and step-by-step programs.

The CEO also credits her success to the fact that she’s a workaholic:

She admits that being a workaholic has helped her get where she is today. With no husband or children, she is said to be married to her job. When the magazine asked how she was able to continue innovating for 27 years, she joked, “Well, because I’m single? I think it’s important to have nothing else to do but work.”

item.title: Meet Dr. Jianxiong Xiao, an artificial intelligence expert who is building a self driving car company
item.dc:creator: Engineer
item.description: This is Dr. Jianxiong Xiao. He’s quite an accomplished man. For starters, he received a PhD from MIT, then became a
item.content:encoded:
This is Dr. Jianxiong Xiao. He’s quite an accomplished man.

For starters, he received a PhD from MIT, then became a professor of computer science at Princeton. Then he left Princeton to become the CEO of AutoX, a self driving car company that is competing against the likes of Google and Uber.

His team of 20 employees, mostly engineers, is quite small, but he believes they have a significant advantage: they have a knowledge of computer vision and artificial intelligence that the other big companies simply can’t match. In other words, he saying they’re actually smarter than the competition.

According to Business Insider, their team was able to build a prototype in just six months, using their own technology. This is a big bonus because they don’t need to rely on anyone else, and that’s a good way to avoid being sued over copyright/IP infringement. In fact, the cameras that they used for their prototype only costed $50 each, and were bought from Best Buy.

Xiao eventually wants to create a product that can be used by existing car manufacturers (like an add-on), rather than manufacturing whole cars like Tesla.

Check out the video of the AutoX prototype in action:
